ticket.title: AssetTagHelper should accept a slightly wider range of protocols
ticket.original-body: _Forgive me if this is the wrong place. I guessed this URL based on recent news and I see little is here yet. Pardon my butting into this transition..._ Before, using image_tag "data:image/jpeg,base64:ABC123" Would create an image tag like: First, the /images prepended to the data: protocol uri completely breaks it. Second the alt attribute is completely useless, and would be better left out. This patch allows image_tag to work with inline images via the data: protocol. While obviously not a best practice, it has its uses and image_tag shouldn't fail to work with idiom. It includes 1 additional image_tag assertion that proves its all working as expected. * "GitHub fork":http://github.com/Squeegy/rails/tree/master

Pardon my butting into this transition..._ Before, using image_tag "data:image/jpeg,base64:ABC123" Would create an image tag like: First, the /images prepended to the data: protocol uri completely breaks it. Second the alt attribute is completely useless, and would be better left out. This patch allows image_tag to work with inline images via the data: protocol. While obviously not a best practice, it has its uses and image_tag shouldn't fail to work with idiom. It includes 1 additional image_tag assertion that proves its all working as expected. * "GitHub fork":http://github.com/Squeegy/rails/tree/master
ticket.original-body-html:
Forgive me if this is the wrong place. I guessed this URL based on recent news and I see little is here yet. Pardon my butting into this transition...

Before, using

image_tag "data:image/jpeg,base64:ABC123"

Would create an image tag like:

First, the /images prepended to the data: protocol uri completely breaks it. Second the alt attribute is completely useless, and would be better left out.

This patch allows image_tag to work with inline images via the data: protocol. While obviously not a best practice, it has its uses and image_tag shouldn't fail to work with idiom.

It includes 1 additional image_tag assertion that proves its all working as expected.

  • GitHub fork

version.body:
_Forgive me if this is the wrong place. I guessed this URL based on recent news and I see little is here yet. Pardon my butting into this transition..._
Before, using
image_tag "data:image/jpeg,base64:ABC123"
Would create an image tag like:
<img src="/images/data:image/jpeg,base64:ABC123" alt="data:image/jpeg,base64:ABC123" />
First, the /images prepended to the data: protocol uri completely breaks it. Second the alt attribute is completely useless, and would be better left out.
This patch allows image_tag to work with inline images via the data: protocol. While obviously not a best practice, it has its uses and image_tag shouldn't fail to work with idiom.
<img src="data:image/jpeg,base64:ABC123" />
It includes 1 additional image_tag assertion that proves its all working as expected.
* "GitHub fork":http://github.com/Squeegy/rails/tree/master
version.body-html:
Forgive me if this is the wrong place. I guessed this URL based on recent news and I see little is here yet. Pardon my butting into this transition...

Before, using

image_tag "data:image/jpeg,base64:ABC123"

Would create an image tag like:

<img src="/images/data:image/jpeg,base64:ABC123" alt="data:image/jpeg,base64:ABC123" />

First, the /images prepended to the data: protocol uri completely breaks it. Second the alt attribute is completely useless, and would be better left out.

This patch allows image_tag to work with inline images via the data: protocol. While obviously not a best practice, it has its uses and image_tag shouldn't fail to work with idiom.

<img src="data:image/jpeg,base64:ABC123" />

It includes 1 additional image_tag assertion that proves its all working as expected.

  • GitHub fork
version.title: [PATCH] AssetTagHelper should accept a slightly wider range of protocols

version.body:
I'm not sure this is a good use of the image_tag method. image_tag tag is there to help you expand image paths and provide you with a "useful" alt tag.
If you really just want "img src="data:image/jpeg,base64:ABC123"", isn't hard coding the img tag the simplest thing?
version.body-html:
I'm not sure this is a good use of the image_tag method. image_tag tag is there to help you expand image paths and provide you with a "useful" alt tag.

If you really just want "img src="data:image/jpeg,base64:ABC123"", isn't hard coding the img tag the simplest thing?
version.diffable-attributes: --- :state: new :title: "[PATCH] AssetTagHelper should accept a slightly wider range of protocols" :assigned_user:
version.title: AssetTagHelper should accept a slightly wider range of protocols

version.body:
Yup I agree that in this case there is no value using image_tag for inline images and in fact it just makes your page slower calling the image_tag helper when you're not really using any of its functionality.
-1 (sorry!)

-1 (sorry!)
